org.chronos.chronodb.api.indexing

Interface Indexer<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The return type of the getIndexValues(Object) method, i.e. the type of index (string, long...) described by this indexer.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DoubleIndexer, LongIndexer, StringIndexer

    public interface Indexer<T>
    A Indexer is an object capable of producing an index value for a given object.

    Chrono Indexers are executed every time an object is saved in ChronoDB to produce the corresponding index entries.

    API users are free to implement their own indexer classes. However, a number of conditions apply.

    • All methods of this class must be idempotent, i.e. consistently return the same result on the same input.
    • Instances of implementing classes must be stateless and in particular must not store references to other objects, unless they are "owned" by the indexer and not accessed anywhere else.
    • Implementing classes must be serializable. ChronoDB will persist them and re-load them as required.
    • Do not implement this interface directly! Implement the sub-interfaces, e.g. StringIndexer or LongIndexer instead.

    As a general best practice, consider implementing this interface with classes that have no fields and do not access any static fields and/or methods.

    For indexers that do have states (i.e. fields), the corresponding classes need to have a proper implementation of #hashCode() and #equals(Object)!

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canIndex(java.lang.Object object)
      Checks if this indexer is capable of processing (i.e. producing an indexed value for) the given object.
      java.util.Set<T> getIndexValues(java.lang.Object object)
      Produces the indexed values of the given object.

    • Method Detail

      • canIndex

        boolean canIndex(java.lang.Object object)
        Checks if this indexer is capable of processing (i.e. producing an indexed value for) the given object.

        This method is guaranteed to be always invoked by ChronoDB before getIndexValues(Object) is called. If this method returns false, then the framework assumes that this indexer is incapable of processing this object and this indexer will be ignored for this object.

        Parameters:
        object - The object which should be indexed. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        true if this indexer can produce an indexed value for the given object, or false if the given object cannot be processed by this indexer.

      • getIndexValues

        java.util.Set<T> getIndexValues(java.lang.Object object)
        Produces the indexed values of the given object.

        This method is only called by ChronoDB if a previous call to canIndex(Object) with the same parameter returned true.

        Parameters:
        object - The object to index. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A Set of elements representing the indexed values for the given object. null-values in the set will be ignored. Subclasses may specify more rigid constraints on this set; please check their documentation. If this method returns null, it will be treated as if it had returned an empty set.
